meanings.definition: To dig up (a body) from the ground.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologists will exhume the ancient remains for study.
meanings.sent2: The authorities decided to exhume the body for further investigation.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a shock to exhume the buried treasure in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The past can sometimes exhume memories we thought were long gone.
meanings.sent5: The act of exhume can reveal secrets hidden beneath the surface.

meanings.definition: To bring to light or uncover (something hidden or forgotten).
meanings.sent1: The detective hoped to exhume new evidence in the case.
meanings.sent2: The journalist's investigation helped to exhume the truth about the scandal.
meanings.sent3: It was like a surprise party to exhume the long-lost family recipe.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to exhume buried emotions from deep within him.
meanings.sent5: The documentary aimed to exhume the forgotten history of the town.
